results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology as a "posttest-only randomized experimental design" (Section 3.4).
Sections 3.1-3.4 provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design, including participant recruitment, lesson delivery, data collection, and analysis plan.
The document states: "The lesson log data can be accessed within the Digital Appendix." and mentions PSLC DataShop as a repository (Section 3.4.1).

While data accessibility is mentioned, the document does not explicitly state any limitations or justifications for not sharing all data. It only mentions that the data is available in the Digital Appendix.
The document mentions "human annotation rubrics" and "learner-sourced examples of coded responses" are located in the Digital Appendix (Section 3.2).
Data collection methods are fully described in Section 3.1 (tutor participants and lesson delivery) and Section 3.2 (Human Open-Response Annotation).
The document does not mention whether the analysis code is shared in an open repository.
Since the code is not mentioned as being shared, there is no justification provided.
The document does not mention whether code for data preparation is shared.
Statistical tests (ANOVA) are clearly described in Section 3.4 and 4.1.
Effect sizes, confidence intervals, and p-values are reported throughout Section 4 (e.g., "estimate = 0.136, SE = 0.054, 𝑝 = .031").
The study is primarily quantitative; subjective context and interpretation are limited.
The study is primarily quantitative; data coding and analysis are not described in a qualitative manner.
Results are clearly presented in Section 4, with figures and tables summarizing the findings.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
